questions.text: Who is the boy who never grew up?
questions.explanation:
Peter Pan.

	"Peter Pan" was written by James M. Barrie.

questions.text: In "The Mystery of Edwin Drood" what is the name of the character that sings "The Wages of Sin"?
questions.explanation:
Princess Puffer.

	In the original Broadway Cast, Princess Puffer was played by Cleo Laine.

Press Your Luck.

	"Press Your Luck" was hosted by Peter Tomarken.

questions.text: In the original Broadway cast of "South Pacific" who played Emile de Becque?
questions.explanation:
Pinza, Ezio.

	"South Pacific" is a Rogers and Hammerstein play and based on the book "Tales of the South Pacific".

questions.text: What kind of bird is usually seen with a pirate?
questions.explanation:
parrot.

	The oldest known parrot (as of 2004) is 104 years old.

questions.text: What is the feminine word for "small" in French?
questions.explanation:
petite.

	Petit would be the masculine form of the word.

questions.text: Which ghost is a poltergeist in the "Harry Potter" series?
questions.explanation:
Peeves.

	According to www.dictionary.com a poltergeist is "a ghost that announces its presence with rapping and the creation of disorder."

questions.text: What singer sang "Cream" and "Little Red Corvette"?
questions.explanation:
Prince.

	Prince Rogers Nelson was born on June 7, 1958.

questions.text: What is "P" the chemical symbol for?
questions.explanation:
Phosphorus.

	Phosphorus was discovered by Hennig Brand of Hamburg about 1674.

Powhatan.

	Powhatan's real name was Wahunsonacock.
